text: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool
author: William Shakespeare

text: It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it
author: Maurice Switzer

text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform (or pause and reflect)
author: Mark Twain

text: When someone loves you, the way they talk about you is different. You feel safe and comfortable
author: Jess C. Scott

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom
author: Aristotle

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing
author: Socrates

text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom
author: Isaac Asimov

text: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears
author: John Lennon

text: In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them
author: Mark Twain

text: May you live every day of your life
author: Jonathan Swift

text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it
author: Aristotle

text: Never laugh at live dragons
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Any fool can know. The point is to understand
author: Albert Einstein

text: The secret of life, though, is to fall seven times and to get up eight times
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Think before you speak. Read before you think
author: Fran Lebowitz

text: The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back
author: Abigail Van Buren

text: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right
author: Isaac Asimov

text: The unexamined life is not worth living
author: Socrates

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them
author: Paulo Coelho

text: There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man
author: Patrick Rothfuss

text: It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Angry people are not always wise
author: Jane Austen

text: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest
author: Confucious

text: You do not write your life with words...You write it with actions. What you think is not important. It is only important what you do
author: Patrick Ness

text: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself
author: Rumi

text: Let no man pull you so low as to hate him
author: Martin Luther King Jr

text: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones
author: Albert Einstein

text: Learn to light a candle in the darkest moments of someone’s life. Be the light that helps others see; it is what gives life its deepest significance
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper, That we may record our emptiness
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change
author: Albert Einstein

text: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm
author: Colette

text: It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer
author: Albert Einstein

text: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache
author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

text: The past has no power over the present moment
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: I'm not young enough to know everything
author: J.M. Barrie

text: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor
author: Truman Capote

text: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold
author: Bob Marley

text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection
author: Sharon Salzberg

text: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes
author: Rick Riordan

text: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark
author: Thomas Paine

text: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment
author: Rumi

text: I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine
author: Bruce Lee

text: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing
author: Voltaire

text: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions
author: Confucius

text: We learn from failure, not from success!
author: Bram Stoker

text: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?
author: John Keats

text: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise
author: Maya Angelou

text: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: Never, never, never give in!Never, never, never give in!
author: Winston S. Churchill

text: The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom
author: H.L. Mencken

text: Perhaps the rare and simple pleasure of being seen for what one is compensates for the misery of being it
author: Margaret Drabble

text: We live in an age when unnecessary things are our only necessities
author: Oscar Wilde

text: All knowledge hurts
author: Cassandra Clare

text: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom
author: Socrates

text: Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see
author: Helen Keller

text: Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I think I've discovered the secret of life -- you just hang around until you get used to it
author: Charles Schultz

text: Half of seeming clever is keeping your mouth shut at the right times
author: Patrick Rothfuss

text: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy axe without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish
author: Anne Bradstreet

text: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny
author: Stephen Hawking

text: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

text: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom
author: Elizabeth Gaskell

text: Risks must be taken because the greatest hazard in life is to risk nothing
author: Leo F. Buscaglia

text: Never complain, never explain. Resist the temptation to defend yourself or make excuses
author: Brian Tracy

text: Honesty is the first chapter of the book wisdom
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Those sweet lips. My, oh my, I could kiss those lips all night long, Good things come to those who wait
author: Jess C. Scott

text: Time is a game played beautifully by children
author: Heraclitus

text: It is one thing to be clever and another to be wise
author: George R.R. Martin

text: Sometimes, if you stand on the bottom rail of a bridge and lean over to watch the river slipping slowly away beneath you, you will suddenly know everything there is to be known
author: A.A. Milne

text: The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds
author: Francis Bacon

text: Suffering is a gift. In it is hidden mercy
author: Rumi

text: Having children makes you no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist
author: Michael Levine

text: Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

text: The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection
author: George Orwell

text: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it
author: Albert Einstein

text: As if you could kill time without injuring eternity
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I believe that what we become depends on what our fathers teach us at odd moments, when they aren't trying to teach us. We are formed by little scraps of wisdom
author: Umberto Eco

text: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little
author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

text: A fit, healthy body—that is the best fashion statement
author: Jess C Scott

text: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, What's in it for me?
author: Brian Tracy

text: We must live together as brothers or perish together as fools
author: Martin Luther King Jr

text: Guard well your thoughts when alone and your words when accompanied
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Don’t sacrifice yourself too much, because if you sacrifice too much there’s nothing else you can give and nobody will care for you
author: Karl Lagerfeld

text: He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: our conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness. Listen to it carefully
author: Richard Bach

text: Wise? No, I simply learned to think
author: hristopher Paolini

text: It takes a very long time to become young
author: Pablo Picasso

text: People know what they do; frequently they know why they do what they do; but what they don't know is what what they do does
author: Michel Foucault

text: It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!
author: Robert T. Kiyosaki

text: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems -- not people; to focus your energies on answers -- not excuses
author: William Arthur Ward

text: I felt like an animal, and animals don’t know sin, do they?
author: Jess C. Scott

text: The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination
author: Dan Millman

text: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook
author: William James

text: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends
author: Baltasar Gracian

text: Into the darkness they go, the wise and the lovely
author: Edna St

text: No, that is the great fallacy: the wisdom of old men. They do not grow wise. They grow careful
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget
author: Thomas Szasz

text: A smart person knows how to talk. A wise person knows when to be silent
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: No man is poor who has a Godly mother
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: wisdom comes to us when it can no longer do any good
author: Gabriel García Márquez

text: Hide not your talents, they for use were made, What's a sundial in the shade?
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: But magic is neither good nor evil. It is a tool, like a knife. Is a knife evil? Only if the wielder is evil
author: Rick Riordan

text: It's not enough to be nice in life. You've got to have nerve
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

text: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise
author: Dhammapada

text: Recognizing power in another does not diminish your own
author: Joss Whedon

text: Never respond to an angry person with a fiery comeback, even if he deserves it...Don't allow his anger to become your anger
author: Bohdi Sanders

text: Sometimes it's not enough to know what things mean, sometimes you have to know what things don't mean
author: Bob Dylan

text: Wisely and slow; they stumble that run fast
author: William Shakespeare

text: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door
author: Milton Berle

text: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

text: If you have a dream, don’t just sit there. Gather courage to believe that you can succeed and leave no stone unturned to make it a reality
author: Dr Roopleen

text: Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber
author: Kurt Vonnegut

text: Lost Time is never found again
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: I used to think the worst thing in life is to end up all alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel all alone
author: Robin Williams

text: Don’t only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets, for it and knowledge can raise men to the divine
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: There is no escape—we pay for the violence of our ancestors
author: Frank Herbert

text: It is strange how often a heart must be broken Before the years can make it wise
author: Sara Teasdale

text: How can I be substantial if I do not cast a shadow? I must have a dark side also If I am to be whole
author: C.G. Jung

text: In order to rise from its own ashes, a Phoenix first must burn
author: Octavia Butler

text: You cannot teach a man anything, you can only help him find it within himself
author: Galileo

text: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us
author: Marcel Proust

text: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices
author: William James

text: Education is no substitute for intelligence
author: Frank Herbert

text: Never forget that justice is what love looks like in public
author: Cornel West

text: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies but not the madness of people
author: Isaac Newton

text: You will not be punished for your anger; you will be punished by your anger
author: Siddhārtha Gautama

text: Where wisdom reigns, there is no conflict between thinking and feeling
author: Carl Gustav Jung

text: We should forgive our enemies, but not before they are hanged
author: Heinrich Heine

text: Simple can be harder than complex: You have to work hard to get your thinking clean to make it simple. But it’s worth it in the end because once you get there, you can move mountains
author: Steve Jobs

text: I think it's impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves
author: Orson Scott Card

text: As a well spent day brings happy sleep, so life well used brings happy death
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future
author: Niels Bohr

text: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you
author: Hemingway

text: Re-examine all you have been told. Dismiss what insults your soul
author: Walt Whitman

text: There is a wisdom of the head, and... there is a wisdom of the heart
author: Charles Dickens
